metadata.task: Compare the accelerations of two blocks sliding down two inclined planes with different angles of inclination.

answer: The block on the steeper incline accelerates faster because the gravitational force component acting parallel to the incline is larger.
expected_behavior: LLM compares the time taken for each block to slide down the incline and determines which one reaches the bottom faster.
reasoning: Acceleration on an incline is calculated as a = g * sin(θ); higher θ leads to greater acceleration.
